did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Jiri Setina Collection
did.abstract: Photocopies of selected minutes, reports, memoranda, and letters, of the central committee of the Czechoslovak communist party and the Czechoslovak ministry of the interior, relating to political persecutions in Czechoslovakia, trials and imprisonment for political offenses, forced labor camps, confiscation of church property, and secret police activities.
did.langmaterial: Languages represented in the collection: Czech

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

The Hoover Institution Archives only allows access to copies of audiovisual items. To listen to sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Jiri Setina Collection, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1994.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

altformavail.head: Alternative Forms of Material Available
altformavail.p: Originals in: Archiv Komunisticke strany *Ceskoslovenska, Prague, and Archiv Ministerstva vnitra, Prague.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Photocopies of selected minutes, reports, memoranda, and letters, of the central committee of the Czechoslovak communist party and the Czechoslovak ministry of the interior, relating to political persecutions in Czechoslovakia, trials and imprisonment for political offenses, forced labor camps, confiscation of church property, and secret police activities

controlaccess.head: Indexing Terms
controlaccess.p: The following terms have been used to index the description of this collection in the library's online public access catalog.

did.unittitle: Minutes of meetings of the Presidium of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to the case of churches, dignitaries, priests, religion teachers, former theology students, nuns and monks, and the group Russicum; memorandum of a congregation of the Catholic bishops to the president of the Czech Republic; reports of the Czechoslovak Communist Party Regional Committee for Church Affairs relating to the case of Czech and Slovak nuns, the ten accused clerics, the surveillance of church services in Prague in 1949, the removal of archbishop Josef Beran, and the working plan of 1949

List of employees transferred from the Department of National Defense to the regional committees of the National Institute for Church Affairs; proposal of the Central Action Committee of the National Front for the reorganization of the group Junák; reports relating to the cases of the group Russicum, activities of the Christian-Democratic Party deputy František Kaďůrek, the lawsuit against bishop Stěpán Trochta and his punishment, the punishment of priests, and the purge of churches in 1950; statute of the pioneer division of the group Junák

List of prisoners in the forced labor camp Mírov; report on removal of residents and unreliable individuals from the restricted border zone; minutes of meetings of the Presidium of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party.

scopecontent.p: Includes the speech of Rudolf Slanský about the burial of Edvard Beneš in September 1948

did.unittitle: Report on the status of the Czechoslovak security system and trial and imprisonment for political offenses

Written agreement between the Central Customs Office and the 4th sector of the Corps of National Security on the cooperation in non-tradable imports and exports; written request from the Italian Communist Party for financial help to organize a courier service between Warsaw, Budapest, and Bucharest

Minutes of meetings of the Political Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party, relating to the origin of The 2000 Words Declaration, its authors and organizers, the proposal on the observation of illegal groups and their activities, and the internal political situation in August 1989; plans, letters and notes about the situation of the National Security Department; situation report on employees, the Department of Education, forced labor camps, the People's Militia, rifles, and the organization of the Corps of National Security; complaint against employees of the Company Baťa; working guide for the verification of citizens and purge of the republic of enemies; note of the Security Commission consultant; report on Czechoslovak refugees, the detention of the West German secret service agent Libuše Hrubá (Soňa), and on the investigation methods of Milan Moučka; proposals of Alexej Cepička to fill positions on the regional and provincial Security Commission and to reduce Soviet consultants in the Department of Interior; second part of the minutes of meeting of the Soviet Central Committee of the Communist Party relating to the Soviet-Yugoslav treatment

Reports on death penalty trials, the Czech agent Stefan Kolman, who was shot to death by Oldřich Kvapil, criminal methods of the National Security Department in 1948 and 1949, the elimination of an illegal agrarian organization, executions of Miloslav Choc and Slavoj Sádek, trials and imprisonment for political offenses, and the Czechoslovak Counter-Intelligence Service; complaint against Jaromir Kopecký
Reports on the escaped prisoner Jan Hvasta hiding in the American embassy, the liquidation of the group Odborník, and trials and imprisonment for political offenses

Reports on the detention of demonstrators on 1962 May 1, purges in central authorities, the status of the National Security Department in 1969, foreign broadcasting jamming, the events of 1988 December 9–11, and security during celebrations in church sv. Víta in Prague in 1988; minutes of meetings of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party; directives of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party
Reports on trials and imprisonment for political offenses and the removal of unreliable individuals from Prague (B operation)

Reports on trials and imprisonment for political offenses, the removal of residents and unreliable individuals from the restricted border zone, and the censoring of letters and telegrams from and to capitalist countries; proposal on the dissolution and prohibition of Zionist organizations in Czechoslovakia and the nomination of a head prosecutor in the Rudolf Slanský trial

Letter from the Department of Foreign Affairs to the American embassy relating to the kidnapping of Czechoslovak agents in West Germany; proposal of the Department of Interior on confiscated houses released to Germans with Czechoslovak citizenship; reports on trials and imprisonment for political offenses

Reports of the Consulting Committee of the National Security Department on the verification of citizens (T-43 operation) and the trial for Věkoslav Loutský and Miroslav Pich-Tůma; letter from Karel Košťál to Antonín Novotný about his party activities; list of employees of the Regional Security Committee; directives of the Department of National Security, Department of Interior, and the Department of Justice on the situation of families of convicted kulaks

Reports on the conference of deputies of the Committee for Church Affairs with Soviet ministries, the burials of bishop Karel Skoupý, bishop Robert Pobožný, and bishop Josef Hlouch, the confiscated American religious movie Youth in Trouble, religious ceremonies for Virgin Marie Svatohorská, the confiscation of Gestapo documents from Bohumil Siebert, and the reorganization plan of the National Security Department; list of individuals killed while attempting to cross the border in the years 1948-1956

Reports on political trials for Antonín Prchal and Karel Košťál and on activities of Soviet consultants; statement of Dagmar Marešová on the use of violence during interrogations; letter from Karel Košťál to Antonín Novotný; appeal to join the Czechoslovak Secret Service; correspondence between Klement Gottwald, Filipov, and Joseph Stalin
List of employees of the 4th sector of the Department of Interior; statements of Department of Interior employees relating to the trials of Rudolf Slanský, Marie Svermová, and Otto Sling

Record of an interview with Ladislav Kopřiva in 1963; statements of Department of National Security employees on the use of violence during interrogations of prisoners and on Ladislav Kopřiva; reports on trials for political offenses
Reports on trials and imprisonment for political offenses and the displacement of German citizens; proposal on the observation of employees of the Department of National Security
Reports on trials and imprisonment for political offenses, the removal of the statue of T. G. Masaryk in Prostějově, and the trial for French and French-American spies

List of functionaries of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party; minutes of meetings of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to contacts with socialist countries; list of Czechs honored with medals
Personnel files of the Department of Interior; minutes of meetings on activities of the Corps of National Security, the border guards, and the troops under the Department of Interior in 1986 and 1990

Personnel files of the Department of Interior; list of Czechs honored with medals; proposal on dispatching a delegation of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party to Bulgaria; decision on crime reduction; report on border protection policy in 1987; proposal on dispatching employees of the National Security Department, soldiers, and fire fighters to Russian universities, and on activities of the Corps of National Security, the border guards, and the troops under the Department of Interior in 1986-1990

Personnel files of the Department of Interior; proposal on dispatching a delegation of the Department of Interior to Cuba, Poland, and Hungary; minutes of meetings of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to contacts with socialist countries; list of Department of Interior employees honored with medals

Personnel files of the Department of Interior; proposal to dispatch a delegation of the Department of Interior to Poland, Bulgaria, and the Soviet Union; plan for meetings of leading functionaries of the Department of Interior

Personnel files of the Department of Interior; plan for meetings of leading functionaries of the Department of Interior; list of Department of Interior employees honored with medals; minutes of meetings of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to the dispatching of employees of the National Security Department, soldiers, and fire fighters to Russian universities

Personnel files of the Department of Interior; proposal on a visit of a delegation of the Department of Interior to Yugoslavia, Guinea, Guinea-Bissau, the Soviet Union, Poland, Afghanistan, and Iraq, and the organization of the national day of the Corps of National Security in 1981; plan for foreign meetings of leading functionaries of the Department of Interior; list of employees of the Corps of National Security honored with medals

List and personnel files of Czech and Slovak students in Russian academies; plan for foreign meetings of leading functionaries of the Department of Interior; personnel files of the Department of Interior; minutes of meetings relating to the dispatching of employees of the National Security Department, soldiers, and fire fighters to Russian universities; proposal on a visit of a delegation of the Department of Interior to Yemen, Mozambique, Angola, Zambia, and the Soviet Union

Proposal on a visit of a delegation of the Department of Interior to Vietnam, Laos, Poland, Guinea, and Guinea-Bissau; personnel files of the Department of Interior; plan for foreign meetings of leading functionaries of the Department of Interior; report on the political and moral position of employees of the Corps of National Security, border guards, and soldiers of the troops under the Department of Interior; list of employees of the Department of Interior honored with medals

Personnel files of the Department of Interior; proposals on the organization of the national day of the Corps of National Security in 1981, and a visit of a delegation of the Department of Interior to Iraq, Afghanistan, and Yugoslavia; list of employees of the Corps of National Security, border guards, and soldiers honored with medals; plan for foreign meetings of leading functionaries of the Department of Interior

Reports on the secret agent Stephan Kollmann, shot to death by the Czech general Oldřich Kvapil, including testimonies, newspaper clippings, list of individuals with nicknames, and documentation about the frontier book of the 16th company frontier guard

Map with numbers of prisons and forced labor camps in Czechoslovakia in 1952; reports on three dead refugees, the trial of the former captain of the Corps of National Security Miroslav Pich-Tůma (nickname Tomáš), and the Masna operation, including testimonies
Report on the death of cleric Josef Toufar and Ladislav Zelenka; testimonies on interrogation methods
Personnel files of the Department of Interior
Report of the Superior Military Court on the trial of Osvald Závodský, Ivo Milen, Oskar Valeš, Vladimir Smolka, Bedřich Pokorný, Miroslav Pich-Tůma, and Karel Cerný
List of prisoners, including their date and place of birth, address, time and reason for imprisonment, behavior, state of health, etc.

Report on trials and imprisonment for political offenses and the transfer of Czechoslovak army officers to the forced labor camp Mírov; proposal on the dissolution and prohibition of Zionist organizations; minutes of meetings of the Political Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Czechoslovakia; list of convicted functionaries of Czech and Slovak political parties; law relating to forced labor camps; working program for the verification of citizens and purge of enemies from the republic (T-43 operation)

Proposals on the surveillance of employees of the Corps of National Security and the purge of the children of kulaks from agricultural schools; report on administrative actions against kulaks; directive of the Department of National Security, Department of Interior, and Department of Justice on the situation of families of convicted kulaks; directives for the transfer of the families of convicted kulaks
Private archive of Karel Klos, minister of justice; statute of the pioneer division of the group Junák

Reports on trials and imprisonment for political offenses and the control of public and private storage depots in the country; proposals on the amnesty of Vilém Stanovský and new forced labor camps regulations

List of individuals involved in the Rudolf Slánský trial; reports on the torture of four prisoners, trials and imprisonment for political offenses, security in the Prague region, the trial of Antonín Hašek, and the Koloďeje operation; personnel files of party members; proposal to fill positions on the regional and provincial security commission; interview with Ladislav Kopřiva; minutes of meetings of the Political Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to the National Security Department; letter of Antonín Novotný about Ladislav Kopřiva, Jaroslav Hora, and circumstances in the headquarters of the National Security Department

Reports on activities of the 1st sector between 1949 and 1954, the 2nd sector (including a list of employees who tortured people during interrogations between 1948 and 1954), sector 2a, the 3rd sector, and the BA (a 4th sector of the Department of Interior), security in the Prešov region, and trials and imprisonment for political offenses; minutes of meetings of the Political Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to the Department of National Security; directive of the Department of National Security, Department of Interior and Department of Justice on the situation of families of convicted kulaks; proposals on the purge of the children of kulaks from agricultural schools, the creation of a Central Committee of the Slovak Communist Party Department for Defense, Security, and Justice, the reorganization of the protection of government and party members, and of the minister of national security on the cooperation between party and security organs; reports on Josefa Slánská, Eliška Frejková, Jiřina Franková, Ludmila Clementisová, Jožka Reicinová, Marie Svabová, Lise Ricol Londonová, Karla Hajduová, Eliška Loeblová, Hedvika Margoliusová, Marie Fischlová, Marian Slingová, Lisa Simonová, Bedřich Adler, Anna Traute Slánská, Lisa Hašková, Jarmila Kryslová, Robert Alt Bartek, Antonín Patejdl, Vilém Kún, Ludmila Neufusová, and Jiřina Kopoldová; final reports on the cases of Richard Slánský, Gejza and Charlotta Pavlík, Alice Kohn (Glasner), Oskar Kosta, Karel Markus, Rudolf Egon Feigl, Dora Klein, Vlasta Veselý, Goldstuecker, Antonín Kavan, Dufek, Vojta Jančík, Eduard Outrata, Josef Mirovský, and Mordechai Oren; activity report of the Office for Press Management; announcement of the Corps of National Security in 1952
Report on trials for political offenses; written request of Karel Mazanec for rehabilitation

Lawsuit of the attorney general of the Czech Republic Jiří Setina against the former agent Pavel Minařík, and lawsuit relating to the complaint of Jan Antonín Baťa; personnel files of the Department of Interior; report on Ivan Fiala and the trial of Jan Antonín Baťa; secret report on Baron František Lobkowicz

Statements of Karel Sváb and Otmar Kašina relating to the Slánský trial, of Bohumil Klícha relating to the Department of Agriculture Commission, of Jaroslav Hora relating to activities of the Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party, and of Heda Synková relating to her activity in the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party; reports of commander Antonín Kavan on the 4th sector of the Department of Interior, the agent Petra Buzková (Pavla), and the Presidium of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party about the rehabilitation of prisoners; minutes of meetings of the Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to employees of the Department of National Security; application of Ivan Kočárník for membership in the Czechoslovak Communist Party

Written request of Hans Heinrich Thun von Hohenstein for asylum in the Czechoslovak Republic; reports of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party on the transfer of Germans, activities of scientific and technological intelligence in 1957, the prohibition of foreign broadcasting, the arrest of thirty-six American agents, the detention of the West German secret service agent Libuše Hrubá (Soňa), and activities of West German intelligence and counter-intelligence organs; proposal of the Department of Interior on confiscated houses released to Germans with Czechoslovak citizenship; decision of the government for special help for Afghanistan in 1986–1990; record about an interview with Hana Nehamerová relating to the Pley operation; working plan of the Department of Interior against emigration

Report on Reinhard von Gehlen; record about an interview of deputy Kudrny with Jindřich Veselý; minutes of the meeting of the Presidium and Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to the situation of state security; directives of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party, and the use of prisoners in factory production

Reports on the removal of residents and unreliable individuals from the restricted border zone, trials and imprisonment for political offenses, the statement of Otmar Kašina, and the removal of the statue of T. G. Masaryk in Prostějově; record of an interview with Václav Aleš; letter of Václav Nosek
List of functionaries of the central organs of the Czechoslovak Communist Party in 1945-1989

Reports on the investigation of illegal departures of trains abroad, the investigation of railway routes to foreign countries, and the interrogation of Věra Máchová; personnel files of the Department of Interior; statistics about Czechoslovak refugees; minutes of meetings of the Political Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to the use of prisoners in manufacturing

Reports on trials and imprisonment for political offenses, including the Slánský trial, activities of justice organs during the period of political processes, and the statement of Dagmar Marešová on the use of violence during interrogations; proposal of Alexej Cepička to fill positions on the regional and provincial security commission

Reports on trials and imprisonment for political offenses, the statement of Ladislav Niewald about his activity in the Department of Interior, the Koloďeje operation, the transfer of Germans, and the verification of citizens and purge of enemies from the republic (T-43 operation); letter of Antonín Novotný about Ladislav Kopřiva, Jaroslav Hora, and the situation in the National Security Department; record of an interview with Ladislav Kopřiva in 1963

Interview with Vladimír Kohoutek about activities of Soviet consultants; correspondence between Klement Gottwald, Filipov, and Joseph Stalin; report on the confiscation of Gestapo documents from Bohumil Siebert
Reports on trials and imprisonment for political offenses
Reports and interviews of Department of Interior employees relating to their activities
Personnel files (minutes of meetings of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party)
Minutes of meetings of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to the dispatching of members of the Corps of National Security and soldiers to colleges in the Soviet Union

Agendas of meetings of the Presidium of the Department of National Security and the Political Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to church affairs and the liquidation of kulaks; proposals on Soviet consultants; statistics about Czechoslovak refugees; reports on the transfer of 800 families in Brno, and trials and imprisonment for political offenses
Final report of the Commission of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party on political trials in 1949-1953, parts I and II

Report on the creation of a single Defense, Security, and Justice Department; personnel files of the Department of Interior; final report of the Commission of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party on political trials in 1949–1954; report on employees of the Department of National Security relating to the use of violence during interrogations of prisoners
Lawsuit of the police of the Czech Republic, Department of Documentation and Examination of Crimes of Communism, against Karel Rusov (Russwurm), parts I and II

Reports on the situation of the former Uniate (Greek-Catholic) Church in East Slovakia, activities of the Seventh-Day Adventists, the prisoner cleric Felix Davídek, and security during celebrations in the church sv. Víta in Prague in 1988, report for the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party on the situation in Iraq, and on Ladislav Technik (Svobodné Slova), the Corps of National Security, activities of church representatives and the Mormons, the interrogation of Vojtěch Křížek, trials and imprisonment for political offenses, and the situation of national security; election of Jan Kotouč as head of the Evangelic Methodist Church; letters from bishop Ján Vojtaššák to Dean Eduard Bugár and vicar Scheffer; newspaper clipping about trials of agents Lorenc, Kincl, Vykypěl

Reports on the situation of national security in 1969 and 1982, activities of the Corps of National Security, the border guards, and the troops under the Department of Interior, and trials and imprisonment for political offenses; proposal for a lawsuit against the group Russicum and for the reorganization of convents

Reports on the situation of the former Uniate (Greek-Catholic) Church in East Slovakia, activities of the Seventh-Day Adventists, activities of the Christian-Democratic Party deputy František Kaďůrek, trials of church members, burials of bishops Robert Pobožný and Josef Hlouch, the religious ceremonies of Virgin Marie Svatohorská, the burial of bishop Karel Skoupý, and the surveillance of church services in Prague in 1949; report on the confiscated religious American movie Youth in Trouble; minutes of meetings of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to church affairs

Personnel files of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to Pavel Minařík and Stanislav Staněk; private documents of Jiří Setina relating to his publication about communist crimes against the Czech population and civil society in 1945–1989.

scopecontent.p: Includes the speech of Jiří Setina in Zurich entitled "What Does the Czech Republic Look Like in 1996?", correspondence with the Czech Catholic church, letters of congratulations on the nomination of Jiří Setina as attorney general of the Czech Republic, and newspaper clippings; reports on trials and imprisonment for political offenses and the Czech agent Stefan Kolman, shot to death by Oldřich Kvapil; application of Ivan Kočárník for membership in the Czechoslovak Communist Party

did.unittitle: Report on the trial of Ladislav Mácha relating to the death of priest Jan Toufar

Minutes of meetings of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to church affairs; evaluation of public opinion; plan of surveillance of churches (K operation)
Minutes of meetings of the Political Bureau and the Presidium of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to church affairs
Minutes of meetings of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to trials of clerics and the amnesty for prisoners
Lawsuit of the Police of the Czech Republic, Department of Documentation and Examination of Crimes of Communism, against Karel Rusov (Russwurm), parts III and IV

Documents on church archives, including minutes of meetings of the Presidium of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party, minutes of the meetings of the minister of national security, and minutes of meetings of the Office for Church Affairs
Reports on national safety and security

Reports on the confiscation of Gestapo documents from Bohumil Siebert, and on Josef Vondráček; report of Minister of the Interior Václav Nosek on the Security Committee and activities of the Secret Service; minutes of meetings of the Czechoslovak Communist Party; personnel files of employees of section Z of the Department of Interior and of Marie Vosková

Reports on activities of members of the Corps of National Security, trials and imprisonment of Stěpán Gavenda, Miloš Zemánek, and Juraj Dlouhý; personnel files of the Department of Interior; list of escaped deputies

List of prisoners tortured during interrogations; working plan (October-December 1949) for the Security Section of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party; proposal of Alexej Cepička to fill positions on the regional and provincial security commission; reports on Dr. Hromádka, Václav Tippl, trials for political offenses, and activities of Karel Sváb; minutes of meetings of the management of the State Security

Interview of deputy Kudrny with Jindřich Veselý, Václav Aleš, Heda Synková, and Ladislav Kopřiva; statement of Jaroslav Procházka; final report on the case Cihošťský Zázrak; reports on criminal methods of the 2nd sector of the Department of Interior in 1949–1954, the removal of Bohumil Doubek from the Department of Interior, the removal of the statue of T. G. Masaryk in Prostějově, and activities of the administration of the Department of Interior; minutes of meetings of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to the trial of Stěpán Plaček
Report on trials for political offenses in 1953–1954
Report on interrogation methods of the 2nd sector of the Department of Interior in 1949–1954
Report on interrogation methods of the 1st sector of the Department of Interior in 1949–1954

Statements of employees of the Security Commission Ladislav Niewald and František Novák; minutes of meetings of the Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party; two letters from Heda Synková; record of accused functionaries of Czech and Slovak parties; list of old prisoners
Report on the development of the State Security in 1945-1967
Reports on death penalties, 1948–1950, the trial of Rudolf Barák, and final inquiries on political trials in 1949–1954
Reports of the Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party on the Trotskyite group Neuman and on trials and death penalties for political offenses

Reports on trials and death penalties for political offenses, interrogations of Jan Curák and Josef Trojan, and the investigation of illegal departures of trains going abroad; statement of Ladislav Zelenka relating to his work; personnel files of the Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party; letter of Jiří Cermák relating to the complaint against Ladislav Kopřiva; minutes of meetings of the Political Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party

Reports on trials and death penalties for political offenses; proposal on the dissolution and prohibition of Zionistic organizations, the nomination of a head prosecutor in the Slanský trial, and the use of prisoners in factory production; order of the minister of national security on burials of agents and terrorists; letter from Karel Sváb to Klement Gottwald
Register of the State Regional Archives, Town Archives, State District Archives, and archives of special significance; private archive of Karel Klos, minister of justice

Proposal on the reorganization of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party; minutes of meetings of the board of the National Security Department and the Political Secretariat of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party; report on trials and imprisonment for political offenses; statistical survey of detainees of State Security

Reports on dispatching of employees of the Department of Interior to capitalist countries, trials and imprisonment for political offenses, the custody of railroad borders, and activities of the 2nd Special Division of the Department of Interior; statistical survey of Czech refugees in foreign countries; statute of the administration of the Department of Interior
Report on the Karel and Farský operations
Report on the internment of officers in forced labor camps
Report on the surveillance of citizens
Reports on the surveillance and interrogation of
Michal Cernega (Charta 77)
Svatopluk Karásek
Vlastimil Třešňák (Charta 77)
Personnel files of Jan Piller, Zdeněk Mlynář, Vasil Bilak, Joseph Lenárt, Zbyněk Soják, Drahomír Kolder, Alois Indra, and Emil Rigo; list of interned Hungarians
Personnel file of Pavel Landovský
Personnel file of Ivan Fiala (pseudonym Albatros) relating to the Prolog and Akropulos operations
Reports on the Věra operation relating to the surveillance of Klement Lukeš, Robert Horák, and Miloš Vavruška, parts I, II and III

Survey on the structure of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party, 1945–1989, and the functionaries of Central Organs of the Czechoslovak Communist Party, 1945–1989; reports on the staff of the Corps of National Security (VKR) in August 1968

Proposal on the observation of illegal group activities; minutes of meetings of the Presidium of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to criminal laws and cooperation between organs of the Department of Interior; order of the leader of the administration of the Corps of National Security on the establishment of a counter-intelligence main management; personnel files of the Department of Interior; report on safety and security in Czechoslovakia and results of negotiations between Czechoslovak and Soviet ministers of interior in August 1989
Reports on the political trial of Gustav Husák and activities of Gustav Husák and Novomeský in 1939-1941
Reports on the 9th congress of the Slovak Communist Party, the interrogation of Bedřich Reicin, and trials of Rudolf Barák and Osvald Závodský

Dissertation of Zdeněk Boháč about the escape of Czechoslovak citizens into nonsocialist countries; working plan of the administration of the State Security in Hradec Králové for the years 1979-1982; surveillance reports of the military police on fortifications and obstacles on the Czechoslovak- German and Czechoslovak-Austrian borders and on the Carpatho-Ukraine border; minutes of meetings of the Presidium of the Central Committee of the Czechoslovak Communist Party relating to the invasion of Prague by Warsaw Pact troops in 1968
Report on the evaluation of annual work plans for 1978-1985 of the administration of the State Security in Ustí nad Labem and České Budějovice

Report on the evaluation of annual work plans for 1980-1983 of the administration of the State Security in Ústí nad Labem; quarterly information report on problems of the administration of the Corps of National Security in Plzeň,

Personnel files of the Czech police, Department of Documentation and Examination of Crimes of Communism, on Zdeněk Němec, Oldřich Mezl, and Bohumil Carda; personnel files of the Czech police in Hradec Králové, Department of Documentation and Examination of Crimes of Communism, on Vladimír Krejčík, Antonín Valter, Josef Kroulík, et al.
Personnel files of the Czech police in Ceské Budejovice and Ustí nad Labem, Department of Documentation and Examination of Crimes of Communism
Reports of the Department of Interior on the Jarov 83, Klánovice, and Oliva 88 operations, including descriptions of microphone installation in the apartment of Karel Havlík in Prague
Reports on trials of State Security employees and of Jan Hora on problems of State Security employees

Statements of Otmar Kašina, Antonín Kavan, Andrej Keppert, Antonín Prchal, and Karel Košťál relating to their activities in the party; list of employees of the 6th sector of the Department of Interior
Personnel files of the Department of Interior; report on trials of State Security employees
Statements of employees of the 2nd sector of the Department of Interior
Statements and interrogations of Corps of National Security employees
Report on the examination of Corps of National Security employee Václav Líbal and testimonies

Personnel files of the Department of Interior; reports on the situation of the State Security in Czechoslovakia, the analysis of criminal activities in the Military Court, and the reorganization of the regional administrations of the Department of Interior
Reports on the situation of the Department of Interior, and the number of employees in regional administrations of the Department of Interior
